body: "We have to remember that news – that holy, sacred source of information - is biased": Throwing Down the Water reminds us to ask a few pertinent questions - "Whose story is being told? Through which eyes? For whose benefit?" - when sifting through the news.
original_body: "We have to remember that news – that holy, sacred source of information - is biased": Throwing Down the Water reminds us to ask a few pertinent questions - "Whose story is being told? Through which eyes? For whose benefit?" - when sifting through the news.
title: Haiti: Can News Ever Be Impartial?

sentence: "We have to remember that news – that holy, sacred source of information - is biased": Throwing Down the Water reminds us to ask a few pertinent questions - "Whose story is being told?
For whose benefit?" - when sifting through the news.
